donors.title: For Donors
donors.subtitle: Check your SaThuCoin balance and deed history
donors.invalid_address: Please enter a valid Ethereum address
donors.no_deeds: No deeds found for this address
donors.wallet_step_2: Create a wallet and save your recovery phrase
donors.wallet_step_4: Share your address with the donation organization
donors.wallet_step_5: After verification, tokens appear in your wallet
donors.add_metamask_desc: Adding the token lets you see your SATHU balance directly in MetaMask.
donors.faq_cost_a: No. SaThuCoin is given to you as recognition for your donation. There are no fees or charges.
donors.faq_use_q: What can I do with SATHU?
donors.faq_use_a: SATHU is a recognition token. It serves as permanent, verifiable proof of your donation on the blockchain.
donors.faq_network_a: SaThuCoin is on Base, an Ethereum Layer 2 network by Coinbase. It is fast and low-cost.
donors.faq_address_q: Is my Ethereum address the same as my Base address?
donors.faq_address_a: Yes. Your Ethereum wallet address works on Base as well.
donors.faq_missing_a: Make sure you have added the SATHU custom token in MetaMask and that you are checking the correct address.

institutions.title: For Institutions
institutions.subtitle: Learn how SaThuCoin works and how your organization can participate
institutions.what_is_p1: SaThuCoin is a digital token that recognizes donors for their generosity. When someone donates to your institution, they can receive SATHU tokens as a permanent, verifiable record of their good deed.
institutions.what_is_p2: Each token is a permanent, verifiable record on the blockchain that cannot be altered or forged.
institutions.how_step_1: Donors provide their wallet address when making a donation
institutions.how_step_2: Your institution reports the donation to SaThuCoin
institutions.how_step_3: Tokens are minted and sent directly to the donor's wallet
institutions.how_step_4: The deed is recorded on-chain with the institution name
institutions.collect_desc: Ask donors for their Ethereum/Base wallet address. It starts with 0x and is exactly 42 characters long.
institutions.collect_prompt: Suggested text for donors: "Please provide your Ethereum/Base wallet address to receive your SaThuCoin reward."
institutions.integration_verify: To verify a donor received tokens, search their address on BaseScan.
institutions.faq_handle_q: Do we need to handle cryptocurrency?
institutions.faq_handle_a: No. You only need to collect the donor's wallet address. Tokens are minted and sent automatically.
institutions.faq_donor_pay_q: Does the donor need to pay anything?
institutions.faq_donor_pay_a: No. Receiving SATHU tokens is completely free for donors.
institutions.faq_verify_q: How do we verify a token was sent?
institutions.faq_verify_a: Search the donor's wallet address on BaseScan to see their token balance and transaction history.
institutions.faq_wallet_q: What wallet should we recommend to donors?
institutions.faq_wallet_a: We recommend MetaMask. Donors can find a setup guide on our For Donors page.

about.title: About SaThuCoin
about.mission_p1: SaThuCoin exists to create a transparent, permanent record of charitable giving. We believe that every act of generosity deserves recognition that lasts forever.
about.mission_p2: By leveraging blockchain technology, we provide donors with verifiable proof of their contributions, while giving institutions a modern way to acknowledge and reward their supporters.
about.how_step_1: A donor makes a contribution to a participating institution
about.how_step_2: The institution verifies the donation and submits it to the SaThuCoin contract
about.how_step_3: SATHU tokens are minted and sent to the donor's wallet
about.how_step_4: The deed is permanently recorded on the Base blockchain
